oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Three overlapping views of Buford College
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Three overlapping views of Buford College, Church Street at 21st Avenue in Nashville. Shows "Scenes from the Kindergarten" (children playing outside and children in the classroom) and "A Day's Outing" (children in horse-drawn carriages).
Buford College was a school for women that was originally founded by Mary Elizabeth Burgess Buford in Clarksville. The school moved to Nashville in 1901 and it closed in 1920.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Education--Tennessee
Kindergartens; Universities & Colleges; Carriages & coaches; Horses; Classrooms; Play (Recreation)
